Sunlight trickled through the trees, changing as with the gentle breeze. Birds could be heard off in the distance, mingling with the trickle of water.
"It's not too much further." came Nathan's voice from behind Kat.

"How did you even find this place?" Kat asked, being careful of her footing as she jumped over the stream as it crossed her path again. She turned back towards Nathan.

"I was doing research in the library, when I came across reference to some sort of temple or something in this forest. Doing some cross referencing, I was able to deduce the rough location of where it'd be." Nathan said, carefully stepping over the stream with his long legs.

Kat turned to continue walking, "And you're sure we're getting close?"

"Positive."

Kat smiled and kept walking. This wasn't the first time that her brother had invited her to explore some ruins with him, and she had to admit that he had a knack for finding some pretty cool places. She had no idea that there were ruins in the forest that was only an hour away from her home, as usually they had to travel to some other country to find them. Her brother had been research a civilization that was only recently re-discovered.

"Wow! There it is!" Kat was brought back to the present by her brother's shout of glee, and him pushing past her suddenly.

"Hey! Watch it" Kat said, punching him in the arm.

"Sorry, it's just so amazing!"

Kat looked at the stone structure before them, that had just seemed to appear from nowhere. A large stone wall was set with pillars that were crumbled and cracked. Two waterfalls fell from above the large opening that had to be the entrance, creating the stream they'd been following. There were also several statues, though they were too worn to make out what they were supposed to be.

"This is incredible! And still in such good shape" Nathan said, walking through the clearing towards the large structure.

Kat ran a couple of steps to catch up, continuing to look up at the building in amazement. Usually when her brother took her some place, it was to see a broken wall or statue, but never a complete building. "This really is awesome Nathan!" Kat mused.

Nathan whipped around to look at her, "So should we go in?"

Kat smiled, "I thought you'd never ask!"

As they walked into the large opening, it became clear that the temple seemed to consist of one large room. It was illuminated by several holes in the ceiling with rubble beneath them. Most of the temple seemed to be bare, except for three pedestals at the far end.

Watching Nathan go to investigate some markings on one of the walls, Kat began to make her way towards the pedestals.

As she approached, she noticed that there seemed to be a statue on each pedestal. The statues were each of women, but one was fat, another had a very well endowed chest, and the third was very pregnant.

Moving closer, she could tell that they were very detailed stone carvings.
